image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith looks at the camera outside a court building

items.synopsis: Victoria Cross recipient Ben Roberts-Smith's decision to sue the publishers of the Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Canberra Times, and three journalists, in the Federal Court over a series of articles published in 2018 backfires.

title.children: Judge throws out Ben Roberts-Smith's defamation case, backs media reports of war crimes, murders

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith surrounded by journalist outside of court

items.synopsis: If Ben Roberts-Smith thought his reputation was in tatters before today, it's hard to imagine what state it's in now, after a Federal Court judge threw out his defamation lawsuit and ruled the most serious imputations made against him had been proven.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith tried to clear his name — it proved to be an expensive own goal

image.altText: Rosemary Walker solo

items.synopsis: National house prices lifted sharply in May, according to data from CoreLogic. Sydney continues to lead the recovery, with rises across the capital cities, as the number of properties advertised for sale fell further.

title.children: Rosemary paid $35k for a modest Sydney home. When it went to auction 45 years later, she thought she 'was going to faint'

image.altText: very red map of australia

items.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology forecasts parched conditions across virtually all of Australia this winter as a double whammy of drought-linked climate drivers brew in waters to the west and east.

title.children: 'Worrying' warm, dry winter tipped for virtually all of Australia

image.altText: A large circular CSIRO logo on the side of a building.

items.synopsis: The payment error was revealed by Greens senator David Shoebridge, who asked CSIRO chief executive Larry Marshall about the overpayment during Senate Estimates.

title.children: CSIRO deputy chair David Knox overpaid by $200,000, money still unrecovered

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Cyril Ramaphosa laugh together while seated in front of a row of flags.

items.synopsis: A member of the ICC, South Africa would theoretically be required to arrest Mr Putin under a warrant issued in March by the court, which accused him of the war crime of forcibly deporting children from Russian-occupied territory in Ukraine.

title.children: South Africa faces political dilemma over whether to arrest Vladimir Putin during upcoming BRICS summit

image.altText: Damage to a residential building at night.

items.synopsis: Witnesses say the three were killed by falling debris while trying to enter the shelter, in what was the highest casualty toll from a single Russian attack on the capital over the past month.

title.children: Kyiv mayor launches investigation after two women and child die outside locked air raid shelter

image.altText: Josh Tongue walks in England kit

items.synopsis: One English cricket supporter put a 100-pound bet on his mates son to one day play Test cricket for England. 14 years on, that faith has paid off.

title.children: England Test debutant Josh Tongue nets optimistic punter $95,000

image.altText: Maroons players smile and hug each other

items.synopsis: The Maroons prevail 18-10 in a scrappy, high-intensity contest in Western Sydney to take a 1-0 lead in the two-game series.

title.children: Queensland wins Women's State of Origin Game I

image.altText: Alex de Minaur reaches for the ball

items.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's hopes of French Open glory end at the hands of the tour's in-form clay court specialist, unseeded Argentine Tomás Martín Etcheverry in straight sets.

title.children: Alex de Minaur stopped in his tracks at French Open by unseeded Argentine

image.altText: Side by side photos of Philip Lowe in Senate Estimates in a navy suit and Angus Taylor appearing on 7.30, also in a navy suit

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank Governor may have triggered a flurry of passive-aggressive share house notes and crushed the dreams of shadow treasurer Angus Taylor in a single Senate Estimates appearance, writes Annabel Crabb.

title.children: When the inflation bubble visited the Canberra bubble

image.altText: Greyhounds racing down a track at night.

items.synopsis: Joyous Treasure was the 27th dog to die on a NSW racetrack this year. An anti-racing group says the "traumatic" accident highlights ongoing issues with track designs and animal welfare.

title.children: Graphic images of 'nightmare' greyhound death reignite safety debate

image.altText: A crime scene at Alice Springs

items.synopsis: Police say the victim was transported to Alice Springs Hospital in a critical condition, but died from his injuries.

title.children: Man dies following alleged stabbing outside Alice Springs pub

image.altText: Two cars are seen smashed at the scene of a fatal collision in Alawa.

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner is examining the actions of police during a pursuit that resulted in the fatal crash that killed a woman in Darwin’s northern suburbs in 2021.

title.children: Police actions 'reasonable' during police pursuit resulting in fatal crash in Darwin, officer says

image.altText: A bald man with a beard wearing a blue blazer, tie and tan pants walks across a street.

items.synopsis: A South Australian police officer denies a claim that his "annoyance and frustration" got the best of him during an attempt to arrest a young woman in 2021. He is facing three counts of aggravated assault.

title.children: Police officer accused of assaulting drunk woman denies losing control of his emotions

image.altText: a man wearing army uniform looking

items.synopsis: Justice Anthony Besanko's full reasons for his judgement are yet to be released, but today he outlined the serious allegations Nine's lawyers had proved the "substantial truth" of.

title.children: What did Ben Roberts-Smith do? This is what his civil case found

image.altText: A boy in a red play tunnel.

items.synopsis: Jana Hunt's four-year-old son Harrison has autism and oppositional defiant disorder. The Sydney mother is worried she won't be able to find the right school for him to start at next year.

title.children: Concerns some schools are contravening disability legislation by not accepting neurodiverse children

image.altText: Man taken to hospital following death of a three-year-old in Riverwood.

items.synopsis: The 45-year-old father recently underwent surgery and is now in a stable condition. He is expected to face charges over the boy's death.

title.children: Father under police guard in Sydney hospital after 3yo boy fatally stabbed

image.altText: A composite image featuring James Marape and Anthony Albanese.

items.synopsis: The security agreement was committed to in January but PNG is not happy with the proposed wording and has raised concerns with Australia's defence minister.

title.children: 'They encroach into our sovereign rights': PNG wants Australia to fix a proposed bilateral security treaty

image.altText: Yarra River turns green

items.synopsis: Authorities say it's likely the bright green substance, believed to be non-toxic, made its way into the river via a nearby drain. People are being urged to steer clear until its source is confirmed.

title.children: Environmental officers investigate bright green substance in Melbourne's Yarra River

image.altText: Four young children smiling and laughing

items.synopsis: Charmaine Harris McLeod, her two daughters, Aaleyn, 6, and Matilda, 5, and her two sons Wyatt, 4, and Zaidok, 2, died after their car collided with a truck near Kingaroy in May, 2019.

title.children: Inquest hears Charmaine McLeod claimed husband raped her and her children in years prior to fatal crash

image.altText: Safety tape is seen cordoning off a four-storey building with visible fire damage to the top floor

items.synopsis: The man accused of murder over the fire that killed five people is already in custody, having been charged with two counts of arson.

title.children: Murder charges laid over fatal Wellington Loafers Lodge hostel fire

image.altText: 3 old rusty petrol bowsers in a row

items.synopsis: There are calls for changes to make the fossil fuel industry responsible for cleaning up old petrol stations, as almost 900 sites across NSW remain derelict.

title.children: Who is liable when a petrol station closes, then fails to clean up?

image.altText: A group of young African men, many wearing suits and holding signs, stand in a group and speak to journalists.

items.synopsis: The law stipulates capital punishment for "serial offenders", as well as life sentences for same-sex intercourse and 20-year sentences for promotion of homosexuality.

title.children: Ugandan president says his country won't be swayed by threats to cut aid over harsh anti-LGBTQ law

image.altText: ChatGPT logo and AI Artificial Intelligence words are seen in an illustration.

items.synopsis: The European Union and the United States say they expect to draft a voluntary code of conduct on artificial intelligence "within weeks" in the hope that other democracies will sign on.

title.children: EU and US set to advance global AI code of conduct amid 'extinction' warning

image.altText: A drone shot of a town by a lake with snow.

items.synopsis: The NSW Snowy Mountains town has seen the highest rise in median house price of any town or suburb in NSW, according to new data from Proptrack.

title.children: Locals say they've been priced out of Jindabyne as house prices more than double over five years

image.altText: A man in a suit walks down court house steps.

items.synopsis: Two men who were throwing potatoes out a car window at pedestrians in what they considered to be a "prank" are jailed for seriously injuring an e-scooter rider, who had to have his eye removed.

title.children: Two men jailed for throwing potatoes out of car, seriously injuring e-scooter rider, who had to have eye removed

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt looks at the camera. Behind him, lights hang from a rafter.

items.synopsis: Corey O'Connell went missing near Jalbarragup, south east of Nannup, in June 2021, with his abandoned car found nearby.

title.children: Police confirm death of missing WA man Corey O'Connell after human remains found

image.altText: Journalists gather around a woman giving a press conference.

items.synopsis: ACT Victims of Crime Commissioner Heidi Yates says walking into court with the alleged victim during Bruce Lehrmann's trial was one of her statutory duties.

title.children: Victims' advocate defends her show of support for Brittany Higgins during rape trial

image.altText: Head of Wagner Group military company Yevgeny Prigozhin speaks to fighters in a forest area.

items.synopsis: Russia's most powerful mercenary, Yevgeny Prigozhin, asks prosecutors to investigate whether senior Russian defence officials committed any "crime" before or during the war in Ukraine.

title.children: Wagner chief calls for investigation into 'crimes' of top Russian defence officials

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and red tie walks to a car with his hair blowing in the wind.

items.synopsis: Justice Department prosecutors obtain an audio recording of former president Donald Trump from after he left office in which he talks about holding onto a classified Pentagon document.

title.children: Recording shows Donald Trump acknowledging he kept classified document on Iran

image.altText: Kim Cattrall looks over her right shoulder wearing plunging grey strapless dress and stands infront of sex and the city sign.

items.synopsis: She was not part of the show's first season, but Kim Cattrall is stepping back into Samantha Jones's shoes. However, there is a catch.

title.children: And just like that, Kim Cattrall returns as Samantha Jones

image.altText: a man standing in a field of cannabis plants

items.synopsis: Hemp advocates hail the much-maligned crop as the billion-dollar saviour to Victoria's ailing timber industry, but politicians are concerned the industry could pave the way to legalising cannabis.

title.children: Is cannabis the new timber? Advocates want industrial hemp to solve Australia’s housing crisis
